p: Furthermore, several multicentric cohort studies demonstrated associations between anosmia and COVID-19 (Gane, Kelly and Hopkins 2020; Lechien et al. 2020). Of note, the pathogenesis of anosmia is not related to olfactory bulb damage demonstrated in SARS-CoV-1-positive mice or to any direct insult to the central nervous system. Instead it has been attributed to non-neural cell expression of SARS-CoV-2 entry genes in the respiratory epithelium (Brann et al. 2020), a finding which has been confirmed in both human and murine models.
